entry.title: Movie: Robocop, starring Joel Kinnaman (2014)
entry.content:
Movie: Robocop, starring Joel Kinnaman (2014)20140619
This was a great movie. I really like how thoughtful it is about
what it means for Alex to be a "RoboCop" and how the political
striving of OmniCorp is the main driver of the plot. It's very
neat. The image of Alex with no body is AMAZING.
  • Movies
  • 2014

entry.title: Movie: Idiocracy, starring Luke Wilson (2006)
entry.content:
Movie: Idiocracy, starring Luke Wilson (2006)20140618
This is a hilarious movie. I really like the way it magnifies
current problems to an absurd degree. It feels almost plausible,
which is really scary.
  • Movies
  • 2006

entry.title: Movie: The Secret Life of Walter Mitty, starring Ben Stiller (2013)
entry.content:
Movie: The Secret Life of Walter Mitty, starring Ben Stiller (2013)20140616
This was a very fun and brilliant shot movie. It had such a weird
plot and some really cool moments.
  • Movies
  • 2013

entry.title: Game of Thrones - Season 4 - Episode 10 - The Children
entry.content:
Game of Thrones - Season 4 - Episode 10 - The Children20140616
The beginning with Jon was pretty great. A very believable
resolution. I thought the scene with Dany and the dragons was
very sad: she has to start treating them like weapons rather than
children. :( Oh man, "The Children" are super cool. Oh man, Arya
was COLD for not killing The Hound. That fight between Brienne
and The Hound was very brutal. It was sad when Tyrion killed
Shae, but epic when he got the power over his dad. Arya's on her
way!
  • TV Shows
  • Game of Thrones

entry.title: Movie: John Carter, starring Taylor Kitsch (2012) (2)
entry.content:
Movie: John Carter, starring Taylor Kitsch (2012) (2)20140615
It was really fun to watch this movie after reading so many of the
books. I love what they did with the Therns. I feel like sequels to
this movie would've been amazing. I thought that the adaptations
from the story were reasonable. The one thing I think would've been
better to include is to make Dejah more annoyed with Carter's lack
of etiquette.
  • Movies
  • 2012

entry.title: Movie: Jack Ryan: Shadow Recruit, starring Chris Pine (2014)
entry.content:
Movie: Jack Ryan: Shadow Recruit, starring Chris Pine (2014)20140614
This was a really fun movie. I love the character of *REDACTED* Ryan and
I think this rendition works really well. Chris Pine plays him
great and Keira Knightley is amazing, as usual. I hope they make
more.
  • Movies
  • 2014

entry.title: Book: Thuvia, Maid of Mars, by Edgar Rice Burroughs (1920)
entry.content:
Book: Thuvia, Maid of Mars, by Edgar Rice Burroughs (1920)20140612
I started this today. I like it a lot, it is nice that Burroughs
realized that Carter's life had become too grand to be the main
character. Carthoris is pretty cool, despite his crazy name.
  • Books
  • 1920

entry.content:

dreams are awesome. The concept of the First is very cool
too. I'm so excited about next season!

entry.content:

entry.title: Game of Thrones - Season 4 - Episode 9 - The Watchers on the Wall
entry.content:
Game of Thrones - Season 4 - Episode 9 - The Watchers on the Wall20140609
I like Yggrit, but I wish she and Jon could talk. I love that the
call Jon "Lord Snow"; it's so funny. It's hard to imagine that
the Wildlings would understand siege tactics when they've never
attacked before and they don't seem to have settlements of their
own. The Oath in the Tunnel was amazing. Jon should've given an
epic speech before going into the tunnel. That was a great
episode!
  • TV Shows
  • Game of Thrones

entry.title: Book: Love and Friendship, and other early works, by Jane Austen (1793)
entry.content:
Book: Love and Friendship, and other early works, by Jane Austen (1793)20140609
I started this today. So far, the letters seem to have the same
style as her future novels, but they lack the charm and impact
because there's no story to go along with that gets you to
understand the characters.
  • Books
  • 1793

entry.content:

entry.title: Buffy & Angel - Season 4 - Episode 21A - Blind Date
entry.content:
Buffy & Angel - Season 4 - Episode 21A - Blind Date20140609
This is a weird episode because Lindsay joins up with Angel and
then immediately goes back. It's fascinating to see the beginning
of how Angel will interact with Wolfram & Hart. It's also nice
that Gun is starting to be in the crew.

entry.content:
Buffy & Angel - Season 4 - Episode 20 - The Yoko Factor20140608
This is an awesome episode. I love how all the feelings start
flowing and revealing more about what the characters really feel.

entry.title: Book: The Gunslinger, by Stephen King (1982)
entry.content:
Book: The Gunslinger, by Stephen King (1982)20140608
I vaguely remember reading this before, but I only really remember
the final scene when he talks to the Man in Black.

The book is vaguely annoying in that basically nothing happens and
it is so clearly the beginning of a grand epic. This fits with
King's claim that it is a single book in seven volumes.

I really like how weird and unexplained the world is. It's clear
that there's some relationship between our world and it, like it is
in the far-flung future or something. But it is so weird that
some people remember some things. The worship of the engine is an
amazing instance of this.

The best part of the book, though, is the "coming of age"
scene. It's totally epic.
  • Books
  • 1982

entry.title: Book: Ready Player One, by Ernest Cline (2011) (2)
entry.content:
Book: Ready Player One, by Ernest Cline (2011) (2)20140607
I love the way that he gets the first key. Classic!

--

I finished the book reading most of the day. This is a great "love
letter to the 80s". There are so many little choices moments. I
like the way things like Firefly and Whedonverse are mentioned. I
love that Halliday is "fascinated by D&D but doesn't have any
friends to play it with"---that's totally like me.

The whole ending sequence was really neat. I like how bizarre it is
and how the coin plays into it. I especially like the final moments
where Wade realizes that the OASIS isn't the most important thing.
  • Books
  • 2011

entry.title: Book: Ready Player One, by Ernest Cline (2011)
entry.content:
Book: Ready Player One, by Ernest Cline (2011)20140606
I started this today. The concept immediately grabs you and seems
like a lot of fun.

entry.title: Book: The Magicians, by Lev Grossman (2009) (3)
entry.content:
Book: The Magicians, by Lev Grossman (2009) (3)20140606
I finished the book today. I couldn't believe how crazy and
unexpected the ending was. It was so sad too... people just making
such bad decisions and ruining their lives.

Alice ending up being soooo tough at the end. It was pretty
awesome.

The reveal was crazy too. I love that it had been tried so many
times. That's cool to think about.
  • Books
  • 2009
